comment.author: 41909278@N08
comment._content:
An extremely rare look at an NA-48, one of 15 built for China. Basically identical to the USAAC's BC-1 and similar to the Harvard Mk I. China was actually one of NAA's better foreign customers, buying the NA-41 (a fixed gear BT-9), the NA-48, and finally the NA-56. The NA-56 was what can only be considered a weird bird - an AT-6 fuselage, with a Harvard Mk I engine and intakes and fixed landing gear!

Doug MacPhail
